prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Irene Bland Jurix Letter, 15 August [1941?]. Accession 27469, Personal papers collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Richard K. MacMaster, History Department, Western Carolina University, Cullowhee, North Carolina, 28 December 1970.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Irene Bland Jurix was the sister of James A. Bland (1854-1911), a native New Yorker and author of many songs, including "Carry Me Back to Old Virginny."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Letter, 15 August [1941?], from Irene Bland Jurix of Lake George, New York, to Haynes Trebor providing a sketch of James A. Bland (1854-1911) as student, House of Representatives page, songwriter, and travelling minstrel performer. Bland wrote over 500 songs and ballads, among them "Carry Me Back to Old Virginny" in 1875, "In the Evening By the Moonlight," and "Oh, Dem Golden Slippers." Jurix states she is trying to finish the story of Bland's life "with the assistance of W.C. Handy, the father of the blues."
